caption.center: HAROLD L. PHILLIPS, Appellant, v. LINDA V. PHILLIPS, Appellee.

court.center: Court of Appeals of Texas, First District, Houston.

opinion.posture: On Appeal from the 306th District Court, Galveston County, Texas, Trial Court Cause No. 96FD2095.
opinion.panel: Panel consists of Chief Justice RADACK and Justices ALCALA and BLAND.
opinion.opinion_text:
Appellant Harold L. Phillips has neither established indigence, nor paid all the required fees. See Tex.R.App.P. 5 (requiring payment of fees in civil cases unless indigent), 20.1 (listing requirements for establishing indigence); see also Tex. Gov't Code Ann. §§ 51.207, 51.941(a), 101.041 (Vernon Supp. 2005) (listing fees in court of appeals); Fees Civ. Cases B(1), (3) (listing fees in court of appeals). After being notified that this appeal was subject to dismissal, appellant Harold L. Phillips did not adequately respond. See Tex.R.App.P. 5 (allowing enforcement of rule); 42.3(c) (allowing involuntary dismissal of case).
The appeal is dismissed for nonpayment of all required fees. All pending motions are denied.
